column2: As a Vulnerability & Patch Management Lead, you will play a crucial role in safeguarding our organization s digital assets. Your primary responsibility will be to identify and address vulnerabilities and patches across our networks, security devices, endpoints, operating systems, databases, middleware software, and applications. You ll work closely with external vendors and internal IT teams to assess risks, mitigate vulnerabilities, and ensure compliance with industry standards. Additionally, you ll be instrumental in shaping our security policies, processes, and guidelines.             Key Responsibilities:             Governance of    Inventory of all software, hardware, and systems    within the organization and assess them for vulnerabilities through regular scans.         Conduct    vulnerability assessments    using both commercial and open-source tools (such as Tenable, AWS, Microsoft, BurpSuite, Metasploit, SonarQube, and Checkmarx) for both cloud-based and on-premises systems.         Collaborate with external vendors to perform comprehensive    penetration testing    to identify potential weaknesses.         Collaborate with IT teams to enable and track    proactive defense    mechanisms such as    patch management and ensure compliance    and system security.         Work closely with internal IT teams to    remediate vulnerabilities    promptly and effectively.           Analyze scan reports and suggest remediation/mitigation plans.             Analyze and track mitigation efforts   , ensuring timely closure of identified vulnerabilities.           Write reports    on vulnerability findings, including recommended remediation steps.         Develop and maintain    security policies, processes, and guidelines    related to vulnerability management.         Ensure    timely delivery of status updates and final reports    to clients and handle queries.         Ensure compliance with industry standards (CIS, NIST, ISO) and meet    SLAs    (Service Level Agreements) for vulnerability management.         Provide    leadership    by guiding the team and fostering a culture of security awareness.         Utilize your    critical thinking skills    to review findings and recommend appropriate actions.         Leverage    data analytics    and tools like    Power BI    to gain insights into vulnerability trends and patterns.               Key Requirements:             Ability to lead and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.         Keen eye for detail and the ability to assess risks objectively and identify security gaps and potential risks.         Proficiency in analyzing security data trends and drawing meaningful conclusions.         Familiarity with using Power BI for data visualization and reporting.         In-depth understanding on Common Vulnerability Exposure (CVE), CVSS and CERT advisory database.         Participate in internal and external audits and present the findings related to VAPT and apprise on the progress as well as answer specific queries.         Provide technical expertise and advice on multiple areas of security technology, including network security, platform security, authentication/authorization systems, application security, and security frameworks.         Participate in and/or lead cross-functional major incident escalations to minimize service disruption and ensure continuity of service.         Analytical thinker willing to think outside the box to resolve customer-impacting situations on first contact; understand customer risk profile.         Keep track of new and existing vulnerabilities on various network security devices and applications for different vendors.               Key Knowledge and Experience:               Vulnerability Management   : Demonstrated expertise in risk-based vulnerability management having    Integrated Threat Intelligence.             Vulnerability Assessment Tools   : Experience with tools like Tenable, AWS, Microsoft, BurpSuite, etc.           Reconnaissance and Discovery Tools: Experience with tools like Amass, Nmap, Masscan, ZMap, DOMLink, recon-ng, etc.             Penetration Testing Tools   : Familiarity with Metasploit and other ethical hacking tools.           Security Standards   : Knowledge of CIS, NIST, and ISO security benchmarks.           Cloud Security   : Experience in securing cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure)           Reporting and Documentation   : Ability to write clear and concise reports.           Automation   : Familiarity with building scalable automation for security tasks.           Improved Accuracy   : Familiarity with threat intelligence and threat-hunting capabilities to make informed security decisions.           Scripting Languages   : Proficiency in languages such as Ruby, Go, and Python.           Threat Intelligence   : Knowledge of threat intelligence sources and practices.           Bug Bounties   : Experience with vulnerability disclosure and bug bounty programs.           Certifications:    CEH, CPT, OSCP, SANS GWAPT, CISSP preferred               Years of Experience -                10-12 years    of relevant experience in vulnerability/ patch management, and penetration testing.
column11: Automation, ISO, Testing tools, Network security, microsoft, Open source, Middleware, Ruby, Information technology, Python

column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Must have skills : Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience Summary :As a Security Architect, you will be responsible for defining the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Your typical day will involve documenting the implementation of cloud security controls and transitioning to cloud security-managed operations using Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM).  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the design and implementation of cloud security architecture using Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of cloud-based systems. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and mitigate security risks, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations. Develop and maintain security policies, procedures, and standards, ensuring alignment with business objectives and best practices. Provide technical guidance and support to project teams, ensuring the successful delivery of secure cloud-based solutions. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Expertise in Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM). Good To Have Skills:Experience with cloud security technologies such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform. Strong understanding of security frameworks and standards such as NIST, ISO, and CIS. Experience with security tools such as vulnerability scanners, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and firewalls. Solid grasp of network security concepts such as VPN, SSL, and IPSec. Experience with scripting languages such as Python or PowerShell for automation and orchestration. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM). The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering secure cloud-based solutions. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience

column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Must have skills : Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE BTECH MTECH  Summary :The Content Engineer/Team Lead will be responsible for Google Chronicle" SIEM/ SOAR content development such as correlation rules, dashboards, reports, custom parsers, SOAR Playbooks. This involves researching and understanding security threats and vulnerabilities and translating that knowledge into actionable content that can be used to detect and respond to security incidents. Roles & Responsibilities: Expert in developing complex correlation rules, playbooks, policies, and custom parsers.  Monitor the effectiveness of content and tune content to minimize false positives and maximize true positives. Conduct ongoing research and participate in industry forums and conferences to stay up to date with the latest security trends to ensure content effectiveness in detecting and preventing new threats. Automate content development and maintenance processes including the use of scripting and other automation tools to streamline content creation and testing. Design and implement security automation and orchestration workflows for areas such as incident triage, threat intelligence and vulnerability management using SOAR platforms, scripting, and API integration. Integrate security tools into the SOAR platform. Manage and analyze data related to security incidents, threats, and vulnerabilities to identify trends and patterns and use this to develop more effective workflows and improve overall security operations. Maintain detailed logs and reports of security automation and orchestration activities, including metrics related to workflow efficiency, incident response times and threat detection rates to provide internal and external stakeholders with updates on SOAR effectiveness. Professional & Technical Skills: At least 5+ years of experience in Information Security, Risk Management, Infrastructure Security. 4+ years of hands-on experience on developing use cases with deep understanding on SIEM configurations, SOAR Playbooks, log parsing etc. Expert in developing complex correlation rules, playbooks, policies, and custom parsers.  Creation of customized dashboards, alerts, and reports. Good understanding of Regular Expression (REGEX), Yara L. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Additional Information: Certifications such as ECSA, ITIL, GIAC-GCIA. Advanced Certification on any SIEM or SOAR products. Knowledge about scripting languages, Python, PowerShell.Education: Bachelor's and above degree in Computer Science, Information & Technology, MIS, Engineering. Qualification BE BTECH MTECH

column2: Project Role : Security Delivery Lead Project Role Description : Leads the implementation and delivery of Security Services projects, leveraging our global delivery capability (method, tools, training, assets).  Must have skills : Endpoint Extended Detection and Response Good to have skills : NA Minimum  7.5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE BTECH MTECH Roles and Responsibilities:1.Assists in EDR platform design, testing and implementation.2.Deep expertise on EDR installation for data enrichment and policy configurations.3.Hands on experience in working with assets, especially supporting EDR deployment in SaaS environment.4.Troubleshoot EDR platform issues.5.Monitor the EDR infrastructure for capacity planning, system health, availability, and optimization.6.Verify custom reports, manage asset groups, policies and validate with clients.7.Maintain a close partnership with EDR vendor on feature requests, upgrade planning, and product roadmap alignment.8.Perform supporting tasks such as system hardening, high availability configurations, and developing backup strategies.9.Identify and implement Automation opportunities in project.10.Review and apply any newly available and applicable updates on EDR components routinely.11.Troubleshoot issues with EDR sources or systems with vendor, and report system defects as needed.12.Coordinate & lead the technical discussions with Client/vendors.13.Identify root cause of EDR platform incidents.14.Provide day to day operational support for Endpoint Security solution having expert level knowledge of Fault Management like Identify and Classify issues.15.Candidate should have knowledge of backup and restoration for EDR configuration as per policy defined.16.Create various reports for remediation, change tracking and on demand basis.17.Very good Understanding for Endpoint Logs to investigate any incidents and suggest remediations. Technical Experience:1.Expert level experience with deployment, maintenance and operations of one or more major Endpoint Security Products example:McAfee, Symantec, TrendMicro, MS Defender, CrowdStrike, Carbon Black, Symantec etc.2.Must have experience in the solution build and design documentation.3.Good to have experience in designing Standard Operating Procedures.4.Must have the understanding on ITSM process i.e. Incident & change management process. Professional Attributes:1.Strong communication and presentation skill2.Evaluate and validate the custom reports and log source groups as per business requirement.3.At least 8+ years of experience in Information Security, Risk Management, Infrastructure Security and Compliance4.4+ years of hands-on experience on EDR administration or development with good Understanding on EDR environments.5.4+ years of experience in designing, administering, troubleshooting EDR tools (e.g., CrowdStrike, MS Defender etc.)6.Mid-level expertise in UNIX, Linux, and Windows 7.Excellent time management and problem-solving skills8.Project/program management experience Educational Qualification:Bachelors or higher Engineering degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or MISAdditional Info:Experience working in a diversified and virtual environment Qualification BE BTECH MTECH

column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Must have skills : Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE BTECH MTECH  Summary :The Content Engineer/Team Lead will be responsible for ??oogle Chronicle" SIEM/ SOAR content development such as correlation rules, dashboards, reports, custom parsers, SOAR Playbooks. This involves researching and understanding security threats and vulnerabilities and translating that knowledge into actionable content that can be used to detect and respond to security incidents. Roles & Responsibilities: Expert in developing complex correlation rules, playbooks, policies, and custom parsers.  Monitor the effectiveness of content and tune content to minimize false positives and maximize true positives. Conduct ongoing research and participate in industry forums and conferences to stay up to date with the latest security trends to ensure content effectiveness in detecting and preventing new threats. Automate content development and maintenance processes including the use of scripting and other automation tools to streamline content creation and testing. Design and implement security automation and orchestration workflows for areas such as incident triage, threat intelligence and vulnerability management using SOAR platforms, scripting, and API integration. Integrate security tools into the SOAR platform. Manage and analyze data related to security incidents, threats, and vulnerabilities to identify trends and patterns and use this to develop more effective workflows and improve overall security operations. Maintain detailed logs and reports of security automation and orchestration activities, including metrics related to workflow efficiency, incident response times and threat detection rates to provide internal and external stakeholders with updates on SOAR effectiveness.  Professional & Technical Skills: At least 5+ years of experience in Information Security, Risk Management, Infrastructure Security. 4+ years of hands-on experience on developing use cases with deep understanding on SIEM configurations, SOAR Playbooks, log parsing etc. Expert in developing complex correlation rules, playbooks, policies, and custom parsers.  Creation of customized dashboards, alerts, and reports. Good understanding of Regular Expression (REGEX), Yara L. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Additional Information: Certifications such as ECSA, ITIL, GIAC-GCIA. Advanced Certification on any SIEM or SOAR products. Knowledge about scripting languages, Python, PowerShell.Education: Bachelor's and above degree in Computer Science, Information & Technology, MIS, Engineering. Qualification BE BTECH MTECH

Must have skills : Security Solution Development Good to have skills : Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) Minimum  12  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience Project Role :Security Architect Project Role Description :As a Security Solution Architect (SA), candidate would be primarily responsible for solution architecture/presales effort on medium to large complexity or owns multiple components of large complex deals. Lead or work as Lead Solution Architect on complex deals. Independently and with little oversight can come up with the solution. Conduct the solution reviews with SME's and the delivery approver. Attend calls with the client team to understand the requirement to bring value and differentiated solution. Should be good to work as individual contributor and good team player. When assigned responsibilities to lead the team, candidate should show leadership qualities to manage the team and get the work done.  Must have Skills :Security Solution DevelopmentGood to Have Skills : Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)Job Requirements :Key Responsibilities : Able to participate in requirements gathering, gathering data requirements, and assisting in the reconciliation of technical requirements. Prepare end to end solution including effort estimation & costing. Involved in preparing the client proposal & response.  Develop statement of work Performs reviews with the delivery leadership. Participation in the client Orals/presentations. Leads negotiations or develop business terms & conditions. Has led solution development for multiple deal types. Work with delivery leads for the approval of solution/efforts. Bring out technical differentiators and value in the solution. Active ownership/accountability in delivering the solution within the specified time frame. Technical Experience : Candidate must have been a Presales experience with maximum coverage around following GRC/Privacy/Strategy domains.  Skill around domains like Risk & Compliance Advisory and Operation, Compliance Management, Security Strategy Frameworks, Risk and Compliance Strategic Advisory, Cyber Security Assessments, Security Architecture Advisory, NIST CSF, Data Privacy, Third Party Risk Assessment ISO 27001, SOX, GDPR, Risk Assessment Services and GRC automation platforms like Archer, ServiceNow Interpret customer needs and design appropriate GRC, eGRC, Cyber Security Strategy, & Data Privacy Management solutions, experience in developing value-based customer proposal closely working with delivery and sales teams. Hands on delivery experience across these domains would be added advantage to utilize the experience while solutioning. Maintain current knowledge of applicable Risk and Data Privacy requirements and accreditation standards, and monitor changes in technology impacting privacy, risk, and compliance posture. Knowledge of leveraging innovation, automation, Gen Ai in GRC solutioning  Work with delivery and capability team keep abreast with latest assets, offerings, solution accelerators to bring in value adds while solutioning. Overall knowledge of GRC, TPRM, Data Privacy tool stack Pre-Sales knowledge on Non GRC Security domains will be an added advantage to work in cross functional deals. Flexibility on need basis in line with the nature the nature of SA  Strong verbal and written communication are a must to be able to document and present complex topics and solutions. Strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills Stay informed about new products, services, technologies, and other information as required to deliver effective solutionsEducational Qualification: Bachelor's and/or Masters degree in related field with 10 to 15 years of work experience Have effective Security Certifications in relevant domains will be added advantageAdditional Info : CISSP, CISM, CISA, CGRC (Good to have) Cloud Security knowledge and certification (AWS, Azure etc.) Good to have) ISO 27k1, 22301, Privacy, Archer, ServiceNow GRC certifications Good to have) Qualification Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience

column2: The SAP BASIS Professional will work closely with project managers, business users, and technical team members to provide technical guidance and support for projects and initiatives ranging in size from minor enhancements to major multi-year initiatives. The Professional must be able lead, document and support the SAP system through key projects, including system migrations, upgrades and support the business initiatives to introduce new functionality and manage the SAP landscape.                                       ?                 TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:                                         ?                   Support and perform SAP Basis Administration activities such as ID creation and transporting objects to different systems.       Perform SAP Security & Authorization design and build.     Document SAP processes, procedures, and plans, including changes, upgrades, and new services.     Install, configure, maintain, migrate, or upgrade the SAP systems as required.     Look into and troubleshoot SAP Basis related issues.     Perform regular maintenance and performance Tuning for Database and SAP systems.     Strong SAP experience in analyzing, designing, proposing, and delivering SAP Technical Architecture Solutions on public/private cloud.     Essential to be capable of deriving an SAP Roadmap for the IT Landscape and provide technical inputs on Best Practices and Recommendations for IT Transformation and Digital Enablement     Essential to have experience in SAP Cloud Solutions with Real-Life Solutions involving SAP Hardware Sizing and SAP Landscape Designing.     Architecting S4 implementation and conversion.     Selecting the appropriate public cloud service based on compute, data, or security requirements.     Identifying appropriate use of public cloud operational best practices.     Expertise required on S/4HANA Conversion- minimum one end-to-end conversion.     Good to have S/4HANA conversion certified Experience in S4 HANA Conversion readiness activities.     Experience in S/4HANA Conversion (1709, 1809, 1909), OS,DB Migration, Installation, Patching, Upgrade, System Copy     Experience in Heterogeneous Migrations to HANA (SOH migration) using DMO Experience in SAP Sizing for HANA version, Classic version, S/4HANA Cloud version.     Experience in Designing, deploy and migrate the SAP ECC system in on premise and on public cloud.     Experience in HA and DR setup for HANA system and other databases.     Good to have exceptional skills in Data Collection, Analysis and Representation.                      Area of expertise (Skills)         REQUIRED SKILLS         12 to 14+ years SAP Basis Administration, to include Oracle, and AIX or Linux OS.       4+ years of SAP HANA experience     SME for Payroll Upgrade and HRSP Pack      HCM Security Expertise of at least 8+ years.     Certifications SAP, HANA, SSL, DB, OS, SSO, DBA, R3, BASIS, ITIL     Experience implementing or upgrading SAP landscapes.     Experience with SAP NetWeaver, PI PO configuration and administration.     Experience monitoring ABAP dumps and database locks.     Experience using SAP Solution Manager for end-to-end system monitoring and alerting.     Experience in SAP kernel updates, SAP plug-in, landscape management, transport, printer setups and troubleshooting.     Experience in creating SAP client copies and deletions.     SAP BTP Cloud experience is a plus.     SAP LVM LAMA experience is a plus.     Maintain a high level of quality while working under pressure and deadlines.     Ability in all areas of technical writing skills for information or infrastructure systems.             Education         Bachelor Degree

column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the security architecture, ensuring that it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Must have skills : Managed Cloud Security Services Good to have skills : Cloud Security Architecture Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Bachelors or above degree in a related field or equivalent full time course Summary :As a Security Architect, you will be responsible for defining the security architecture, ensuring that it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Your typical day will involve working with Managed Cloud Security Services and Cloud Security Architecture to design and implement secure cloud solutions.  Roles & Responsibilities: Design and implement secure cloud solutions using Managed Cloud Security Services and Cloud Security Architecture. Define the security architecture, ensuring that it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that security is integrated into all aspects of the cloud solution. Provide guidance and support to development teams to ensure that security is built into the solution from the ground up. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Experience with Managed Cloud Security Services. Must To Have Skills:Strong understanding of cloud security architecture. Good To Have Skills:Experience with Cloud Security Architecture. Solid grasp of security best practices and standards, including ISO 27001, NIST, and PCI DSS. Experience with security tools and technologies, including firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention systems, and vulnerability scanners. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and mitigate security risks. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Managed Cloud Security Services. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering secure cloud solutions. This position is based at our Chennai office. Qualification Bachelors or above degree in a related field or equivalent full time course

column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Must have skills : Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operations Good to have skills : NA Minimum  15  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Minimum 15 years of full time education Summary :As a Security Architect, you will be responsible for defining the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Your typical day will involve documenting the implementation of the cloud security controls and transitioning to cloud security-managed operations. Responsibilities: Architect end-to-end IAM solutions based on business needs, considering scalability, security, and usability. Develop IAM architectures, including identity provisioning, access management, single sign-on, and directory services. Lead the implementation of IAM frameworks, defining standards, policies, and procedures. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and align IAM solutions with organizational goals. Evaluate and select appropriate IAM technologies and tools, considering industry best practices. Provide technical leadership and guidance to IAM implementation teams, ensuring successful project delivery. Conduct assessments and audits of existing IAM systems, identifying areas for improvement and optimization. Stay updated on emerging IAM trends, technologies, and security threats, incorporating them into the architecture where applicable.Requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field. 15+ years of experience in IAM architecture design and implementation. Deep expertise in IAM technologies such as (but not limited to) Identity Governance, Privileged Access Management, LDAP, SSO, etc. Strong understanding of identity protocols (e.g., OAuth, SAML, OpenID Connect) and security frameworks. Experience with cloud-based IAM solutions and integration with enterprise systems. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail. Effective communication skills and the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISA are advantageous. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 15 years of experience in Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operations. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful security solutions. This position is based at our Noida office. Qualification Minimum 15 years of full time education

column1: Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)-Security Architect
column2: Project Role :Security Architect  Project Role Description :Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations. Must have skills :Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)  Good to have skills :Splunk Administration Minimum 3 year(s) of experience is required  Educational Qualification :Bachelors or above degree in a related field or equivalent full-time course. Key Reponsibilities :1 Should able to understand client threat landscape, provide consulting insight to improve the security monitoring coverage 2 Should be proficient in writing regexes and building custom parsers 3 Understand user access controls, different user roles, applying roles-based access control 4 Good experience in all log source onboarding methods for example Syslog, agent base, agent less, pull or push methods, API 5 Should have better understanding of SIEM vendor best practices and recommendations 6 Should have SME level of understanding on each SIEM components 7 Good understand of network requirements and constraints for inter component as well as for log source communications Technical Experience : 1 Good to have experience on cloud based SIEM platforms 2 Experience in data parsing, normalizing, and segregation 3 Good experience in optimizing SIEM license by suggesting log filtering 4 Should have experience in SIEM standalone component deployment, single site and multi-site cluster deployment 5 Have experience in documenting the design, implementation, transition, and use case specification documentations 6 Have experience in creating knowledge objects, correlations searches, dashboards, and reports9 Good understanding of use case development lifecycle 7 Understanding of resource requirement for SIEM components according to log volume and use case requirement Professional Attributes :1 Strong analytical skill with a structured problem-solving approach 2 Effective communicator with great interpersonal skills and the ability to be credible with clients 3 Demonstrated creativity in complex problem solving and ability to work under pressureFlexible for 24X7 shifts 2 Comfortable for night shift

column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Must have skills : Data Loss Prevention (DLP) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  7.5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Minimum 15 years of full time education Summary :As a Security Architect, you will be responsible for defining the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Your typical day will involve documenting the implementation of the cloud security controls and transitioning to cloud security-managed operations.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the design and implementation of data loss prevention (DLP) solutions for cloud environments. Develop and maintain cloud security architecture and standards, ensuring compliance with industry regulations and best practices. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and mitigate security risks, including conducting security assessments and audits. Provide technical guidance and support to project teams, ensuring the successful delivery of secure cloud solutions. Stay up-to-date with the latest security trends and technologies, integrating innovative approaches for sustained competitive advantage. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Expertise in Data Loss Prevention (DLP) solutions for cloud environments. Good To Have Skills:Experience with cloud security technologies such as AWS Security Hub, Azure Security Center, and Google Cloud Security Command Center. Strong understanding of cloud security architecture and standards, including compliance with industry regulations and best practices. Experience with security assessments and audits, including vulnerability scanning and penetration testing. Solid grasp of cloud security technologies and tools, including firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention systems, and security information and event management (SIEM) solutions. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 7.5 years of experience in Data Loss Prevention (DLP) solutions for cloud environments. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering secure cloud solutions. This position is based at our Chennai office. Qualification Minimum 15 years of full time education

column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Must have skills : Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operations Good to have skills : NA Minimum  12  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Minimum 15 years of full time education Summary :As a Security Architect, you will be responsible for defining the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Your typical day will involve documenting the implementation of the cloud security controls and transitioning to cloud security-managed operations. Responsibilities: Architect end-to-end IAM solutions based on business needs, considering scalability, security, and usability. Develop IAM architectures, including identity provisioning, access management, single sign-on, and directory services. Lead the implementation of IAM frameworks, defining standards, policies, and procedures. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and align IAM solutions with organizational goals. Evaluate and select appropriate IAM technologies and tools, considering industry best practices. Provide technical leadership and guidance to IAM implementation teams, ensuring successful project delivery. Conduct assessments and audits of existing IAM systems, identifying areas for improvement and optimization. Stay updated on emerging IAM trends, technologies, and security threats, incorporating them into the architecture where applicable.Requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field. 15+ years of experience in IAM architecture design and implementation. Deep expertise in IAM technologies such as (but not limited to) Identity Governance, Privileged Access Management, LDAP, SSO, etc. Strong understanding of identity protocols (e.g., OAuth, SAML, OpenID Connect) and security frameworks. Experience with cloud-based IAM solutions and integration with enterprise systems. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail. Effective communication skills and the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISA are advantageous.Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 12 years of experience in Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operations. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful cloud security solutions. This position is based at our Noida office. Qualification Minimum 15 years of full time education

column2: we're seeking an experienced Global IT Manager with strong analytical, technical, and strategic skills to join us as the hands-on founding member of Blis new IT department       This department is responsible for all employee-facing technology, from services such as domain and directory management, to email and other applications, to hardware assets, and beyond     Reporting to the CTO, you will help set the vision, standards, and best practices for Blis IT estate and help grow the department to 3 - 5 people over the next year     As a hands-on role, you will lead by example to ensure Blis is in control of its security, business continuity, costs, and the ability of the business to achieve its objectives       Blis is a cloud-native and deeply technical business and you will work primarily with modern technologies, SaaS-based applications, and a savvy employee base     We don t build or run physical data centers or servers, we don t have a traditional corporate intranet, and we solve our IT challenges at Internet scale     Google Cloud and Workspace are the backbones of our estate     With an informal, non-hierarchical culture that rewards curiosity and avoids bureaucracy, you'll have exposure and opportunities to involve yourself with projects and teams across the company     You will succeed by balancing detail orientation, pragmatism, and a thirst for boldness and making a difference       This is a full-time position based in Blis Mumbai office     The role allows flexible working from home for up to two days a week     You will be working routinely with other team members in Mumbai and the UK and the aim is to have 3 - 4 hours of overlapping core hours per day           The role and key responsibilities             Define, document, and oversee Blis employee-facing IT policies and practices         Consolidate and manage Blis various employee-facing IT systems and assets         Oversee IT vendor relationships, negotiate costs, and manage the IT budget         Manage and define the standards for Blis IT support partner(s) or teams         Ensure Blis is protected from security threats and business continuity risks         Work with Engineering and DevOps on shared technologies and strategies         Identify other risks within the IT function and seek their solutions         Collaborate with senior leaders to identify how IT can help us succeed         Determine and manage appropriate IT audits and certifications         Work with the Data Protection Officer to ensure Blis IT systems are compliant with all relevant regulations and protect the privacy of people s personal data         Provide visibility to the Board on the state of Blis IT         Help define and manage the growth strategy for the IT department         Oversee a potential future ISO27001 process             Requirements             At least 5 years of experience managing cross-functional IT in a mid-sized, technically advanced organization         Deep knowledge of Google Workspace (GSuite) as the employee backbone         Experience with SaaS orchestration frameworks, such as Bettercloud         Familiarity with corporate email technologies and concepts          Comfort with office networking and video conferencing administration         Knowledge of employee endpoint/asset management         Experience with remote working challenges and balanced BYOD strategies         Solid understanding of general IT software and hardware concepts, including systems administration             Overview of vital existing systems             Google Workspace (productivity, document management, user directory)         Slack (messaging)         BambooHR (HRIS)         ManageEngine (endpoint management)         Continia, Microsoft Dynamics, Concur (Finance)         Zoho (CRM)         Atlassian (ticketing, internal wiki)         Office365 (office apps for compatibility purposes)         Adobe (design software)
column11: Ticketing, Networking, HRIS, Analytical, Agile, Asset management, Document management, Adobe, CRM

We provide a very good working environment since IT is seen as a business enabler by the top-level management with an additional focus on Cyber Security                      You will have access to leading edge Cyber Security Intelligence sources working with a world class Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP)                     Within this role you will get the opportunity to work in an enterprise environment                      You will be integrated in a great global team with a structured getting things done mentality, providing outstanding opportunity for training on the job complemented with external provided subject matter education                      Work from home is possible in alignment with your colleagues and the current task you are on but need to comply with local agreed policies                     Your future role:                     You will learn from experienced colleagues how the global ANDRITZ IT Security landscape is setup and managed                     You will become part of the internal IT Security team working with our external MSSP s Security Operations Center (SOC)                     You will handle relevant security incidents according to your development level from basic and standard activities up to major incidents if required supported by clearly defined incident response processes and leading edge external cyber security intelligence                     As part of our global team, you will participate in regular analysis of the IT security situation, utilizing both internal information sources and external Cyber Security Intelligence input. column2: Morgan Stanley is looking for a talented individual to join a team of information security experts responsible for protecting Firm, client, and employee sensitive/confidential data     The Incident Response team is responsible for managing the detection and reporting of information security and insider threat incidents, supporting all Firm Business Units     The team coordinates with the Business Units, Legal, Corporate Security and IT to gather incident details, assess risk and assist with remediation, ensuring compliance to regulatory and Firm standards     The selected candidate will be located in Bangalore, working with a global team of Information Security professionals         Note:    This is a non-technical role, involving insider threat incident handling only. It is unrelated to the CIRT/CERT or Security Operation Center (SOC) function, as to what is generally referred to in the market.        Job Responsibilities:           Conduct daily review, triage, and escalation of detected, and user reported Insider Threat events      Collect supporting information and relevant artifacts in support of Incident Response activities      Coordinate the response to iRespond incidents from start to finish, including but not limited to utilizing defined workflows to assess the severity of an incident, appropriate mitigation activities, communication across the organization, and ensuring proper documentation is produced outlining the details of the incident.     Host calls with senior members of the Firm to develop quick response plans to information security incidents      Participate in the review of information security incident handling and post-mortem analysis, in order to highlight control gaps across the organization or process gaps within the team      Provide general Information Security advisory services to key stakeholders across the Firm as required      Participate in projects related to operational improvements and tooling      Provide on call and out of hours support       Required Skills :           Bachelors degree or equivalent      Experience in a similar role or working knowledge of Incident Management, Information Security, or Data Privacy      Ability to analyse data to

column2: Job Summary Do you enjoy working with a highly motivated and talented team working to safegaurd mission critical assets? Are you passionate about Security? Do you like to innovate?   Zee is the place for you. We are hiring for self-motivated Security engineer!!!  A opportunity towards making impact to million of users daily across the world. In a world increasingly subject to digitalization and the use of technology, Cyberattacks have become increasingly commonplace and the trend continues to move upward. This individual contributor role would be an intergral part of the security team. The person would be responsible for securing the mission critical assets of the organization with use of Security products and developing new custom innovative security solutions. This position is a technical, hands-on role that also involves investigating and responding to cyber security incidents, with a focus on intelligence-driven incident response.  Job description  The primary responsibility Design, implement, and maintain secure cloud architecture solutions for [Company Name]'s cloud infrastructure. Develop and enforce cloud security policies, standards, and best practices. Conduct regular security assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses in the cloud environment. Collaborate with DevOps, engineering, and IT teams to integrate security controls into cloud-native applications and services. Monitor cloud infrastructure for security breaches and respond to security incidents in a timely manner. Stay up-to-date with emerging threats, security technologies, and industry trends to continuously improve cloud security posture. Provide guidance and support to internal teams on cloud security best practices and procedures. Participate in the evaluation and selection of cloud security tools and technologies. Bring Innovation towards new Engineering security solutions for Cloud environment. Perform threat modelling for the cloud workloads and ensuring all possible attack path vector matrices are calibrated.  Mentor and motivate team members by exhibiting high standards of professional and technical excellence Drive awareness within team and outside teams on the latest threat landscape Coordinate with other peer teams to incorporate security in initial architecture design  Lead the development and implementation of effective security controls to secure protected and sensitive data and ensure information security and compliance with relevant legislation and legal interpretation Lead and drive security architecture review for any new deployments/applications(Dockerized or Monolithic applications) and provide security guidance for any changes in the existing Infrastructure. Review and drive the implementation of security controls based on the security assessments done by different cloud and security vendors.  Create threat advisory for attacks possible on Cloud and ensure stakeholders coordination and follow-up Ensuring security and encryption of databases and big data workload resources. Creating security standards for ensuring securing in AI/ML related workloads Other tasks and responsibilities as assigned. Knowledge & Experience B.Tech/ Bachelors degree in a related field. 10-12 years of experience working in IT security. Hand on Experience with security best practices in IaaS/PaaS services such as Azure, Google Cloud Adequate exposure on API security and cloud micro services technologies Hand on Experience with security methodologies and processes, and technical security solutions.  Commitment to documentation and tracking results via enterprise ticketing/collaboration platforms Working experience with security assessment tools like Metasploit, Burp suite, Wireshark etc. Foundational understanding in application security, cryptography, PKI, network security, security in server less environments and micro services-based architecture Knowledge of TCP/IP Protocols, network analysis, and network/security applications. Knowledge of common Internet protocols and applications.  Personal Attributes Passion for security. Ethics of security.   Excellent analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy.  Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills.  Required self-starter who can work with minimal supervision.  Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills. Willingness to challenge traditional thinking by actively engaging in constructive dialogue Preferred 10 - 12 years of Total experience in Security domain 4 - 6 years of hands on experience with Azure/Google cloud infrastructure 4 - 6 years of experience in Network security Coding experience: Powershell, C#, Python, Shell Hands on Experience troubleshooting Windows and Linux OS issues It's not expected that any single candidate would have expertise across all of these areas - we're looking for candidates that are particularly strong in a few areas, and have some interest and capabilities in others. Zee has a Digital Industry start-up culture that emphasizes transparency, collaboration and career growth, with the ability to work on small, nimble teams. Employees are able to create change at scale and have an opportunity to truly disrupt and shape one of the fastest growing industry

column2: Establishing a strong Cloud Governance Framework is essential for any organisation that uses Public Cloud for hosting Services or using vendor Software                                  As A Service (SaaS).              The role will be responsible for working with IT teams across Nomura Group to ensure we have a Cloud Governance Process that incorporates responsibilities including the design, implementation, and ongoing compliance of the Nomura Public Cloud Policy.                            The CBO Lead will help:                    Determine the objectives for the process along with Nomura s GCGC.                  Design and implement the Cloud Governance framework.                  Establish and maintain the Governance structure, roles and processes for cloud services using industry best practices.                  Provide leadership and guidance to IT teams on aspects of compliance within Nomura Group.                  Monitor and evaluate the performance and conformance of cloud services and capabilities producing metrics to confirm adherence.                  Identify and manage the risks and issues related to cloud adoption and usage.                  Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders from business, IT, corporate functions across Nomura Group, as well as external partners and vendors on cloud governance matters.                          Skills and qualifications:                      A bachelor s degree in computer science, information systems, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.                  A strong knowledge and experience in IT Governance frameworks, principles and practices, as well as the related policies standards and guidelines.                  A good knowledge and experience in cloud computing concepts, technologies, platforms and regulatory requirements.                  A strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to lead motivate teams, manage projects and resolve conflicts. column2: Project Role : Security Delivery Lead Project Role Description : Leads the implementation and delivery of Security Services projects, leveraging our global delivery capability (method, tools, training, assets).  Must have skills : Identity Access Management (IAM) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  2  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE Job Description:IBM Security Verify AccessWe are seeking a skilled IBM Security Verify Access Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting IBM Security Verify Access (formerly known as IBM Security Access Manager) solutions to provide secure authentication and single sign-on capabilities for enterprise applications and services. The IBM Security Verify Access Engineer will work closely with our clients and internal teams to understand business requirements, design scalable solutions, and ensure the reliability and security of Verify Access infrastructure.Responsibilities: Design, deploy, and maintain IBM Security Verify Access solutions to provide secure authentication and single sign-on (SSO) capabilities for web and mobile applications. Develop and implement Verify Access configurations, authentication policies, and access control rules to enforce security policies and regulatory requirements. Collaborate with application owners, developers, and system administrators to integrate applications with Verify Access and optimize performance. Configure and manage Verify Access components, including reverse proxy servers, authentication servers, and policy servers. Monitor Verify Access infrastructure for security threats, vulnerabilities, and performance issues, and take proactive measures to mitigate risks and ensure compliance with security policies. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Verify Access configurations, connectivity, and performance in collaboration with cross-functional teams. Develop and maintain documentation, standards, and best practices for Verify Access administration and configuration management. Stay up-to-date with the latest IBM Security Verify Access technologies, features, and best practices to continuously improve Verify Access infrastructure and capabilities. Provide technical guidance and support to junior team members and assist with knowledge sharing and training initiatives.Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Proven experience working as an IBM Security Verify Access Engineer or a similar role in a large-scale enterprise environment. In-depth knowledge of IBM Security Verify Access architecture, configuration, and administration. Hands-on experience with IBM Security Verify Access appliances, including WebSEAL, Reverse Proxy, and Policy Server. Strong understanding of authentication protocols and standards, including SAML, OAuth, OpenID Connect, and LDAP. Experience with web server technologies, such as Apache HTTP Server and IBM HTTP Server (IHS). Proficiency in scripting languages, such as PowerShell, Python, or Bash. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail. Effective communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Relevant certifications, such as IBM Certified Deployment Professional Security Access Manager V9.0, are a plus. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. Qualification BE

column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Must have skills : Identity Access Management (IAM) Good to have skills : Microsoft Azure Active Directory Minimum  2  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience Summary :As a Security Architect, you will be responsible for defining the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Your typical day will involve documenting the implementation of the cloud security controls and transitioning to cloud security-managed operations.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the design and implementation of Identity Access Management (IAM) solutions for cloud-based applications and infrastructure. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the IAM solutions meet business requirements and performance goals. Define and document the implementation of cloud security controls, including access management, authentication, and authorization. Transition to cloud security-managed operations, ensuring the IAM solutions are effectively managed and maintained. Professional & Technical Skills:-Azure AD Architecture Design:Lead the design, planning, and architecture of Azure Active Directory environments to meet the organization's requirements for scalability, performance, and security. Define directory structure, identity models, and access controls to support cloud-based applications, services, and user communities.Identity Management:Architect and manage Azure AD user accounts, groups, and roles to facilitate seamless identity management and access control for cloud-based resources. Implement user provisioning, de-provisioning, and synchronization processes to ensure consistent user access across on-premises and cloud environments.Single Sign-On (SSO) Integration:Configure and manage SSO integration between Azure AD and cloud-based applications, such as Office 365, Azure services, and third-party SaaS applications. Implement identity federation, authentication protocols (e.g., SAML, OAuth), and conditional access policies to enable secure and seamless user authentication and access.Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA):Design and implement MFA solutions within Azure AD to enhance authentication security and protect against unauthorized access. Configure MFA policies, authentication methods, and verification options to enforce multi-factor authentication for critical applications and sensitive data.Identity Governance:Develop and implement identity governance policies, processes, and controls within Azure AD to enforce least privilege access, segregation of duties, and compliance with regulatory requirements. Implement role-based access control (RBAC), entitlement reviews, and access certification processes to ensure proper governance and accountability for user access.Security Monitoring and Incident Response:Monitor Azure AD logs, events, and access attempts to detect and respond to security incidents promptly. Implement security information and event management (SIEM) integration, threat detection, and automated response mechanisms to mitigate security risks and unauthorized access attempts.Directory Synchronization:Configure and manage directory synchronization services, such as Azure AD Connect, to synchronize user identities, attributes, and group memberships between on-premises Active Directory and Azure AD. Implement directory synchronization filters, custom attribute mappings, and password synchronization mechanisms to ensure data consistency and integrity.Identity Federation Services:Architect and configure identity federation services, such as Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) or Azure AD Federation Services, to enable federated authentication and single sign-on (SSO) between on-premises and cloud-based environments. Implement federation trust relationships, claims-based authentication, and identity mapping to facilitate seamless user access and authentication.Compliance and Reporting:Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies related to identity and access management. Generate compliance reports, access audit logs, and security dashboards to demonstrate compliance with security controls and provide visibility into Azure AD activities.Documentation and Training:Maintain accurate documentation of Azure AD configurations, policies, procedures, and architectural guidelines. Provide training, guidance, and support to IT teams, system administrators, and helpdesk staff on Azure AD best practices, troubleshooting techniques, and security protocols.Must have knowledge on Azure SSO and Azure MFA?Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 2 years of experience in Identity Access Management (IAM). This position is based at our Gurugram office. Qualification Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience
column11: microsoft azure, identity access management, sso, active directory, azure active directory, event management, cloud security, access management, siem, incident response, identity management, iam, security engineering, saml, azure sentinel, oauth

column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Must have skills : Identity Access Management (IAM) Good to have skills : Microsoft Active Directory AD Minimum  2  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience Summary :As a Security Architect, you will be responsible for defining the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Your typical day will involve working with Identity Access Management (IAM) and Microsoft Active Directory (AD) to implement cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Roles & Responsibilities: Design and implement security solutions for cloud-based applications and infrastructure, with a focus on Identity Access Management (IAM) and Microsoft Active Directory (AD). Define and document the implementation of cloud security controls, ensuring they meet business requirements and performance goals. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the security architecture aligns with business objectives and regulatory requirements. Provide technical guidance and support to project teams, ensuring security best practices are followed throughout the project lifecycle. Professional & Technical Skills:-Active Directory and LDAP Architecture:Lead the design, planning, and architecture of Active Directory domains, forests, and LDAP directory services to meet the organization's requirements for scalability, performance, and interoperability. Define directory schema, object classes, attributes, and access controls to support identity and access management needs.Domain and Forest Configuration:Install, configure, and manage Active Directory domain controllers and LDAP servers to provide directory services and authentication mechanisms for users and applications. Implement replication topologies, site configurations, and trust relationships to ensure high availability and fault tolerance.User and Group Management:Define and enforce user provisioning, de-provisioning, and group membership processes within Active Directory and LDAP directories. Implement access controls, group policies, and attribute-based access control (ABAC) policies to enforce least privilege principles and ensure data security.Directory Integration and Federation:Configure and manage identity federation services, such as Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS), to enable single sign-on (SSO) and identity synchronization with cloud-based applications and services. Implement federated trust relationships, claims-based authentication, and identity mapping to facilitate seamless user access across heterogeneous IT environments.Group Policy Management:Develop, implement, and manage group policies within Active Directory to enforce security settings, desktop configurations, and application restrictions across organizational units (OUs) and group memberships. Configure Group Policy Objects (GPOs), security templates, and administrative templates to standardize system configurations and enforce compliance with security policies.Security and Compliance:Implement security best practices, controls, and auditing mechanisms to protect Active Directory and LDAP environments from unauthorized access, data breaches, and insider threats. Monitor directory logs, events, and access attempts to detect and respond to security incidents promptly. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements related to identity and access management.Backup and Recovery:Develop and implement backup and recovery strategies for Active Directory databases, LDAP directories, and system state data. Perform regular backups, test restoration procedures, and maintain backup copies off-site to ensure data integrity and availability in the event of system failures or disasters.Performance Monitoring and Optimization:Monitor Active Directory and LDAP performance metrics, such as CPU usage, memory utilization, directory search times, and replication latency. Identify performance bottlenecks, scalability issues, and resource constraints. Optimize directory configurations, replication settings, and infrastructure components to improve performance and reliability.Documentation and Training:Maintain accurate documentation of Active Directory and LDAP configurations, policies, procedures, and troubleshooting guidelines. Provide training, guidance, and support to IT teams, system administrators, and helpdesk staff on Active Directory and LDAP best practices, troubleshooting techniques, and security protocols.Continuous Improvement:Continuously assess and improve the effectiveness and efficiency of Active Directory and LDAP management processes, tools, and workflows. Implement process improvements, technology enhancements, and best practices to streamline directory management activities and enhance the organization's security posture.Good to know Azure AD and Azure SSO Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 2 years of experience in Identity Access Management (IAM) and Microsoft Active Directory (AD). The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful security solutions. This position is based at our Gurugram office. Qualification Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience
column11: microsoft active directory, cloud security, identity access management, active directory, iam, cyber security, information security, vulnerability management, siem, security framework, sso, security engineering, security controls, ldap, azure active directory

Roles & Responsibilities: Design and implement cloud security architecture, including IAM and AD, to meet business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure security controls are integrated into the cloud environment. Provide technical guidance and support to project teams on cloud security best practices and standards. Professional & Technical Skills:Architecture Design and Planning:Lead the design, planning, and architecture of Active Directory domains, forests, and LDAP directories to meet the organization's requirements for scalability, performance, and interoperability. Define directory schema, object classes, attributes, and access controls to support identity and access management needs, ensuring seamless integration between AD and LDAP environments.Integration Strategy:Develop and implement integration strategies between Active Directory and LDAP directories to enable centralized identity management and authentication across heterogeneous IT environments. Design and implement directory synchronization, federation, and authentication mechanisms to facilitate seamless user access and authentication for internal and external applications.Domain and Forest Configuration:Architect and configure Active Directory domain controllers and LDAP servers to provide directory services and authentication mechanisms for users and applications. Implement replication topologies, site configurations, and trust relationships to ensure high availability, fault tolerance, and data consistency across AD and LDAP environments.User and Group Management:Define and enforce user provisioning, de-provisioning, and group membership processes within Active Directory and LDAP directories. Implement access controls, group policies, and role-based access control (RBAC) policies to enforce least privilege principles and ensure data security and compliance with regulatory requirements.Security and Compliance:Develop and implement security best practices, controls, and auditing mechanisms to protect Active Directory and LDAP environments from unauthorized access, data breaches, and insider threats. Monitor directory logs, events, and access attempts to detect and respond to security incidents promptly. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements related to identity and access management.Group Policy Management:Architect and manage Group Policy Objects (GPOs) within Active Directory to enforce security settings, desktop configurations, and application restrictions across organizational units (OUs) and group memberships. Configure security templates, administrative templates, and other policy settings to standardize system configurations and enforce compliance with security policies.Backup and Recovery:Develop and implement backup and recovery strategies for Active Directory databases, LDAP directories, and system state data. Perform regular backups, test restoration procedures, and maintain backup copies off-site to ensure data integrity and availability in the event of system failures or disasters.Performance Optimization:Architect and optimize Active Directory and LDAP environments to improve performance, scalability, and reliability. Monitor performance metrics, identify bottlenecks, and implement optimization strategies such as index tuning, query optimization, and infrastructure scaling to ensure optimal directory service performance.Documentation and Training:Maintain accurate documentation of Active Directory and LDAP configurations, policies, procedures, and architectural guidelines. Provide training, guidance, and support to IT teams, system administrators, and helpdesk staff on Active Directory and LDAP best practices, troubleshooting techniques, and security protocols.Continuous Improvement:Continuously assess and improve the effectiveness and efficiency of Active Directory and LDAP management processes, tools, and workflows. Implement process improvements, technology enhancements, and best practices to streamline directory management activities and enhance the organization's security posture.Good to know Azure AD and Azure SSOAdditional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 7.5 years of experience in Identity Access Management (IAM) and Microsoft Active Directory (AD). The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful cloud security solutions. This position is based at our Gurugram office. Qualification Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience
column11: microsoft active directory, cloud security, information technology, identity access management, iam, architectural design, data security, advertising, sso, identity management, active directory, security engineering, ldap, azure active directory

column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Must have skills : Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience Summary :As a Security Architect, you will be responsible for defining the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Your typical day will involve documenting the implementation of the cloud security controls and transitioning to cloud security-managed operations using Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM).  Roles & Responsibilities: Design and implement security solutions for cloud-based applications and infrastructure using Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM). Develop and maintain security policies, procedures, and standards for cloud-based environments. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure security controls are integrated into the cloud architecture. Provide technical guidance and support to operations teams for cloud security-managed operations. Stay updated with the latest advancements in cloud security and integrate innovative approaches for sustained competitive advantage. Professional & Technical Skills:Splunk Platform Administration:Lead the administration and configuration of Splunk deployments, including Splunk Enterprise, Splunk Cloud, and Splunk Universal Forwarders. Configure data inputs, indexes, search heads, and distributed search peer configurations to optimize performance and ensure data integrity.Infrastructure Management:Manage Splunk infrastructure components, including indexers, search heads, deployment servers, and forwarders, to ensure high availability, fault tolerance, and scalability. Monitor system resource utilization, disk space, and performance metrics to proactively identify and address infrastructure issues.Data Ingestion and Parsing:Design and implement data ingestion pipelines to collect, parse, and index machine data from diverse sources, including servers, network devices, security appliances, and applications. Configure Splunk inputs, sourcetypes, and field extractions to normalize and enrich data for effective search and analysis.Search and Reporting:Develop and optimize search queries, dashboards, and reports within Splunk to extract actionable insights from machine data. Implement saved searches, alerts, and scheduled reports to proactively monitor system health, security events, and operational metrics.Security Monitoring and Threat Detection:Implement Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) capabilities to monitor and detect security threats, anomalies, and suspicious activities within the organization's IT environment. Configure correlation searches, threat intelligence feeds, and security incident response workflows to facilitate timely detection and response to security incidents.Log Management and Retention:Define and implement log management policies, retention schedules, and data lifecycle management strategies within Splunk. Configure data archiving, compression, and retention settings to optimize storage utilization and comply with regulatory requirements.Integration and Automation:Integrate Splunk with other IT and security tools, systems, and data sources to enhance visibility, correlation, and automation capabilities. Implement integration mechanisms such as Splunk Add-ons, REST APIs, and scripting to automate data ingestion, incident response, and remediation workflows.Performance Optimization:Optimize Splunk performance and resource utilization through tuning, indexing strategies, and infrastructure scaling. Monitor and analyze system performance metrics, search execution times, and indexing throughput to identify bottlenecks and optimize configurations for optimal performance.Incident Response and Troubleshooting:Lead incident response and troubleshooting efforts for Splunk-related issues, including system outages, data ingestion failures, and search performance issues. Coordinate with vendors, technical support teams, and internal stakeholders to resolve escalated issues and minimize service disruptions.Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:Maintain comprehensive documentation of Splunk configurations, procedures, troubleshooting guides, and best practices. Provide training, guidance, and support to IT teams, system administrators, and Splunk users on platform usage, capabilities, and best practices.Exp in Shuffle SOARAdditional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Splunk Security Information and Event Management (SIEM). The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful security solutions. This position is based at our Gurugram office. Qualification Bachelor or college degree in related field or equivalent work experience
