column2: IT Security, Sr Staff                       The Engineering Excellence Group drives innovation velocity and enterprise infrastructure automation, which are critical elements of our growth and scaling strategy. This team is chartered to drive significant productivity, robustness, agility, and time-to-market advantage in the creation of Synopsys products and solutions. The group also leads corporate infrastructure transformation as we continue to drive IT operations leadership and invest in the next wave of disruptive technologies.                                                       Key Roles & Responsibilities:                                 Lead and manage IT security-related programs and initiatives, ensuring alignment with cross-functional stakeholders, organizational goals, industry best practices, and regulatory requirements.                                 Maintain vulnerability management processes and policies using a risk-based priority methodology.                                 Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, engineering, product, legal, and compliance, to integrate security requirements into business processes and the product development lifecycle.                                 Manage the planning, execution, and delivery of IT and security projects, ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and quality standards.                                 Define and track key security metrics and performance indicators to measure the effectiveness of security programs and initiatives, such as vulnerability management, incident management, change management and others.                                 Guide and implement security best practices throughout the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).                                 Develop, evaluate, and endorse security architectures, aligning them with organizational goals and industry standards.                                 Design security frameworks for emerging technologies across diverse platforms and environments.                                 Monitor and integrate advancements in cyber security to refine our architectural practices.                                 Identify and implement opportunities for process automation and improvement.                                 Lead overarching security architecture projects.                                 Required Skills                                 Extensive experience with Vulnerability Management Scanning Tools (eg, Qualys, Rapid7, Tenable, Wiz, etc)                                 Understanding and experience with Federal, PCI Compliance and Security Frameworks such as NIST and CIS.                                 Familiarity with Containerization Solutions (eg, Docker, Kubernetes, etc)                                 Extensive experience with Infrastructure, Cloud, and Risk Assessment                                 Fundamental understanding of Systems and Network Engineering                                 Demonstrated experience and success with completion of risk assessments and vulnerability assessments.                                 Experience in conducting vulnerability scans and knowledge of industry standard scoring models such as CVSS, CCSS                                 Operationalizing MITRE Attack & TTPs in vulnerability prioritization                                 Demonstrated experience and success with development and promulgation of enterprise-class security policy and standards.                                 Strong familiarity with OWASP Top 10, SANS/CWE Top 25 software security vulnerabilities                                 Strong knowledge across the technology stack such as web protocols, multiple operating systems, hypervisors, and distributed systems architecture.                                 Extensive experience in infrastructure and cloud security, including best practices in cloud environments such as AWS, Google Cloud Platform, OCI, or Azure.                                 Strong foundation in network security and infrastructure.                                 Experience and hands on knowledge of Identity Access management security controls.                                 Experience as a multidomain security SME.                                 Experience & Education                                 15+ years of experience in cyber security including Vulnerability Management for Corporate and/or Cloud Systems                                 Masters/bachelors degree in information security, Computer Science, or related field, with 12+ years of focused experience in information security architecture.                                 Proficiency in security assessments, application architectures, data center security and integrating security within the SDLC framework.                                 Familiarity with IT Audit lifecycle and frameworks.                                 Mastery of cloud security concepts.                                 Experience conducting vulnerability assessments, code reviews and penetration tests against system and application technologies, services, platforms, and languages to find flaws and exploits.

column2: We are looking for a highly motivated and energetic individual to join our Digital Health team     This role will lead a local team of resources working across Medtronic s Digital Health group with skills ranging from development to testing to deep technologists     As an IT Manager, you will oversee the daily operations of the local resources and join the Digital Health Leadership team to stay apprised of activities, align on demand and support the growth of your team     You will partner with Digital Health product delivery and service teams to drive the successful implementation and ongoing enhancements software solutions being used across Medtronic product families to provide the best experience to physicians and patients     Medtronic is a leader in medical devices and the Digital Health team contributes through novel use of technology and application development to support therapies     This role will focus on leading Digital Health delivery team members that serve our patients, caregivers, and healthcare professionals             POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES         Develops solutions to complex problems, which require the regular use of ingenuity and innovation     Ensures solutions are consistent with organization objectives     Maintain awareness of the current state of Digital Health initiatives and tools/skills needed by local resources     Focus on expanding capabilities of the local team to help with Digital Health work across business units     Work with the IT leaders to ensure alignment of strategies and roadmaps to local delivery work     Partner with Digital Health colleagues to enhance development, testing and other technology usage practices     Work closely with other IT leaders to maintain alignment with standards and processes     Coordinate various SMEs and interested parties across MDT to increase communication and clarify collaboration opportunities     Facilitate meetings & discussions with cross functional representatives from Digital Health to collect, interpret, document and prioritize business and operational strategies and requirements that will achieve the customers and business goals   Manage the expectations of the customer (ie balance their needs with wants and educate as appropriate)     Communicate delivery vision to project teams, key business stakeholders, and executive leadership     Other Duties as requested             Education Required         Bachelors degree         Job Experience         8+ years of IT or related experience with B.A or B.S      4+ years of IT or related experience with M.A. or M.S.          Specialized Knowledge or Skills Required         4+ years of leadership experience in functional area or related field     Understanding of quality regulations and testing techniques required for the Life Sciences industry     Demonstrated strong analytical thinking, process mapping, process improvement and problem-solving skills     Strong communication skills (verbal, written, influencing groups)     Time management, organizational, influencing, negotiating and leadership skills     Ability to mentor and coach junior team members     Ability to interact effectively with all levels of management     High energy and motivation with an ability to adapt to change     Experience with Agile Methodology      Excellent verbal and written communication skills     Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment     Strong collaboration skills         DESIRED/PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:          Background in healthcare     Strong demonstrated ability to work directly with technical leads and other engineers     Demonstrate a creative and innovation-driven ability to articulate engineering quality paradigms and patterns     Aware of CI/CD (Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment Automation     5+ years business analyst, requirements gathering and process mapping experience.     Advanced degree in Computer Science or business related discipline.     MBA or other masters level education.     Experience in the development and support of integrated IT business service offerings including design, delivery, and support.     Strong process and project management skills as well as the ability to direct multiple large project teams

column2: We are seeking an experienced and customer-focused Senior Technical Account Manager (TAM) to join our team. In this role, you will serve as the primary technical point of contact for our strategic customers, ensuring their success with our solutions. You will build strong relationships, provide expert guidance, and act as a trusted advisor to help clients achieve their business objectives. Key Responsibilities Customer Relationship Management: Develop and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key stakeholders at strategic customer accounts. Technical Guidance: Provide expert technical advice and guidance on the use of NICE products and solutions, helping customers maximize their value. Issue Resolution: Proactively identify, troubleshoot, and resolve technical issues, ensuring customer satisfaction and success. Project Management: Coordinate and manage technical projects, including product implementations, upgrades, and customizations, ensuring timely and successful delivery. Advocacy: Act as the voice of the customer within NICE, advocating for their needs and requirements to internal teams. Training and Enablement: Conduct training sessions and workshops to educate customers on product features, best practices, and new releases. Performance Monitoring: Monitor and analyze customer usage and performance metrics, providing insights and recommendations for optimization. Reporting: Prepare and deliver regular status reports, technical reviews, and executive briefings to customers and internal stakeholders.
column11: Customer Relationship Management, Project Management, Training and Enablement, Performance Monitoring

column1: IT&D Senior Manager - Controls Assurance Leader
column2: Reckitt is on a journey to improve General IT Controls (GITCs) across our enterprise. The IT&D Senior Manager, Controls Assurance Lead will be responsible for their IT General Controls Assurance Controls squads, and delivery of the IT&D SOX compliance testing strategy.                              The Controls Assurance Team will be made up of SAP and non-SAP testing squads, who, under your leadership will provide IT general controls testing assurance across Reckitt. Working with our IT, business, and external partners, you will deliver a robust and efficient testing methodology to deliver the Controls Transformation Programme which will meet UK SOX standards.                    Your responsibilities                  Manage and partner with 3rd parties when necessary to ensure quality delivery of ITGC s assurance work, ensuring budget and deliverables are met.                          Review and benchmark against the general controls testing practices of other companies and monitor for regulatory changes. Ensure the programme testing framework is robust and fit for purpose.                          Partnering with our IT, business, and external partners, you will deliver robust and efficient testing methodologies which will meet UK SOX standards.                          Test design and operational effectiveness (DE/TOE) of ITGCs across products and platforms in line with Reckitt s established methodology and annual testing strategy.                          Ensure work papers and results are documented in an agreed format and tool.                 The experience were looking for                    You will             have, or be working towards certifications such as CISA, CISM, CISSP, cloud security, or similar.                              With 12+ years of overall experience and 5-7 years gained within healthcare/pharma/FMCG industries with experience of working within internal/external IT controls function mandatory.                              Ability to work at a strategic level, whilst maintaining project/operational level oversight.                              Experience of managing a multi-skilled IT team including recruitment, onboarding, coaching, and training where necessary.                              You will be able to demonstrate a deep understanding of multiple controls frameworks.                              You will have a working understanding of SOX and how general (technical) IT controls should work across applications, infrastructure, and utility tools.                           Experience of setting up automated testing through tools such as SAP GRC, Celonis, AuditBoard and Bots.
column11: Relationship management, Cism, Stakeholder Engagement, Assurance, Cisa, Pharma, Healthcare, FMCG, Operations, Recruitment

column2: Project Role : Security Delivery Lead Project Role Description : Leads the implementation and delivery of Security Services projects, leveraging our global delivery capability (method, tools, training, assets).  Must have skills : Identity Access Management (IAM) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  2  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE Job Description:IBM Security Verify AccessWe are seeking a skilled IBM Security Verify Access Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting IBM Security Verify Access (formerly known as IBM Security Access Manager) solutions to provide secure authentication and single sign-on capabilities for enterprise applications and services. The IBM Security Verify Access Engineer will work closely with our clients and internal teams to understand business requirements, design scalable solutions, and ensure the reliability and security of Verify Access infrastructure.Responsibilities: Design, deploy, and maintain IBM Security Verify Access solutions to provide secure authentication and single sign-on (SSO) capabilities for web and mobile applications. Develop and implement Verify Access configurations, authentication policies, and access control rules to enforce security policies and regulatory requirements. Collaborate with application owners, developers, and system administrators to integrate applications with Verify Access and optimize performance. Configure and manage Verify Access components, including reverse proxy servers, authentication servers, and policy servers. Monitor Verify Access infrastructure for security threats, vulnerabilities, and performance issues, and take proactive measures to mitigate risks and ensure compliance with security policies. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Verify Access configurations, connectivity, and performance in collaboration with cross-functional teams. Develop and maintain documentation, standards, and best practices for Verify Access administration and configuration management. Stay up-to-date with the latest IBM Security Verify Access technologies, features, and best practices to continuously improve Verify Access infrastructure and capabilities. Provide technical guidance and support to junior team members and assist with knowledge sharing and training initiatives.Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Proven experience working as an IBM Security Verify Access Engineer or a similar role in a large-scale enterprise environment. In-depth knowledge of IBM Security Verify Access architecture, configuration, and administration. Hands-on experience with IBM Security Verify Access appliances, including WebSEAL, Reverse Proxy, and Policy Server. Strong understanding of authentication protocols and standards, including SAML, OAuth, OpenID Connect, and LDAP. Experience with web server technologies, such as Apache HTTP Server and IBM HTTP Server (IHS). Proficiency in scripting languages, such as PowerShell, Python, or Bash. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail. Effective communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Relevant certifications, such as IBM Certified Deployment Professional Security Access Manager V0, are a plus. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

Must have skills : Endpoint Extended Detection and Response Good to have skills : NA Minimum  5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE BTECH MTECH Key Responsibilities:1.Assists in EDR platform design, testing and implementation.2.Deep expertise on EDR installation for data enrichment and policy configurations.3.Hands on experience in working with assets, especially supporting EDR deployment in SaaS environment.4.Troubleshoot EDR platform issues.5.Monitor the EDR infrastructure for capacity planning, system health, availability, and optimization.6.Verify custom reports, manage asset groups, policies and validate with clients.7.Maintain a close partnership with EDR vendor on feature requests, upgrade planning, and product roadmap alignment.8.Perform supporting tasks such as system hardening, high availability configurations, and developing backup strategies.9.Identify and implement Automation opportunities in project.10.Review and apply any newly available and applicable updates on EDR components routinely.11.Troubleshoot issues with EDR sources or systems with vendor, and report system defects as needed.12.Coordinate & lead the technical discussions with Client/vendors.13.Identify root cause of EDR platform incidents.14.Provide day to day operational support for Endpoint Security solution having expert level knowledge of Fault Management like Identify and Classify issues.15.Candidate should have knowledge of backup and restoration for EDR configuration as per policy defined.16.Create various reports for remediation, change tracking and on demand basis.17.Very good Understanding for Endpoint Logs to investigate any incidents and suggest remediations. column2: Job Role : Senior IT Consultant Shift Timing: 2pm to 11pm IST Duration: 6-12 months (C2H; fulltime 40 hours/week) Overview We are seeking a skilled, adaptable, and teamwork-oriented Systems Administrator to assist with several ongoing IT and cybersecurity initiatives. Projects include:  Planning, building, and testing DLP policy both in O365 and on user workstations  Testing and implementing PAM solution (Delinea)  Creating patching and reboot schedules for production Windows servers The successful candidate will be responsible for working with our Operations and Cyber Security teams to implement PAM and DLP solutions throughout the organization. This role will also assist with our MDM environment to deploy applications and policies to end user workstations, Windows and Mac. Creating patching windows for our production servers will require close partnership with various stakeholders to ensure maintenance downtime does not negatively impact the business.  Responsibilities  Design, test, and implement PAM solution alongside cybersecurity team.  Strategize and test DLP policies to protect our data in the cloud and on end-user workstations.  Create and enforce mobile device policies and procedures via JAMF and InTune.  Experience with Windows patch management, preferably Automox.  Collaborate with various teams to test new application builds before deploying through MDM.  Perform advanced level troubleshooting and remediation of issues with endpoints devices and deployed applications.  Create and audit data leak protection rules for BYOD devices via InTune (both laptop and mobile).  Collaborate with the Cyber Security team to ensure all security protocols are being met by our various MDM solutions and deployments. Experience & Qualifications  Minimum 3-5 years of relevant work experience with Endpoint Security, MDM, O365  Knowledge in managing both Windows and Apple devices.  Knowledge in managing Apple Business Manager and DEP.  Previous experience building and working with PAM solutions. (Delinea preferred)  Previous experience building and working with DLP policies.  Previous experience supporting workstations via InTune and JAMF Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Ability to effectively contribute to multiple projects simultaneously.  Strong understanding and background of working with large endpoint device management environments.  Knowledge in MDM architecture and infrastructure.  Excellent teamwork, time-management, and organizational skills.  Excellent communication skills.  Regularly work with multiple departments to accomplish changing business needs.  Proven analytical and problem-solving ability.  Demonstrated leadership and personal project management skills.  Ability to act as an individual contributor as well as part of a larger team. Locations : Mumbai, Delhi / NCR, Bengaluru , Kolkata, Chennai, Hyderabad, Ahmedabad, Pune, Remote

column2: Overview We are seeking a skilled, adaptable, and teamwork-oriented Systems Administrator to assist with several ongoing IT and cybersecurity initiatives. Projects include: *Planning, building, and testing DLP policy both in O365 and on user workstations * Testing and implementing PAM solution (Delinea) * Creating patching and reboot schedules for production Windows servers The successful candidate will be responsible for working with our Operations and Cyber Security teams to implement PAM and DLP solutions throughout the organization. This role will also assist with our MDM environment to deploy applications and policies to end user workstations, Windows and Mac. Creating patching windows for our production servers will require close partnership with various stakeholders to ensure maintenance downtime does not negatively impact the business.  Responsibilities * Design, test, and implement PAM solution alongside cybersecurity team. * Strategize and test DLP policies to protect our data in the cloud and on end-user workstations. * Create and enforce mobile device policies and procedures via JAMF and InTune. * Experience with Windows patch management, preferably Automox. * Collaborate with various teams to test new application builds before deploying through MDM. * Perform advanced level troubleshooting and remediation of issues with endpoints devices  and deployed applications. * Create and audit data leak protection rules for BYOD devices via InTune (both laptop and mobile). * Collaborate with the Cyber Security team to ensure all security protocols are being met by  our various MDM solutions and deployments. Experience & Qualifications * Minimum 3-5 years of relevant work experience with Endpoint Security, MDM, O365 * Knowledge in managing both Windows and Apple devices. * Knowledge in managing Apple Business Manager and DEP. * Previous experience building and working with PAM solutions. (Delinea preferred) * Previous experience building and working with DLP policies. * Previous experience supporting workstations via InTune and JAMF Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities * Ability to effectively contribute to multiple projects simultaneously. * Strong understanding and background of working with large endpoint device management environments. * Knowledge in MDM architecture and infrastructure. * Excellent teamwork, time-management, and organizational skills. * Excellent communication skills. * Regularly work with multiple departments to accomplish changing business needs. * Proven analytical and problem-solving ability. * Demonstrated leadership and personal project management skills. * Ability to act as an individual contributor as well as part of a larger team.
column11: PAM, cyber secuitry, Endpoint security, MDM, O365, patch management

column2: Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding career in the field of cybersecurity? Do you want to work for a progressive and innovative company that values its employees and offers exciting opportunities for professional growth? If so, Torry Harris Integration Solutions might be the perfect fit for you.    Torry Harris Integration Solutions is a leading digital transformation, integration, and service delivery partner with a global presence. We are committed to helping our clients achieve success in their digital journeys by providing cutting-edge solutions and services. As part of our expansion, we are currently seeking a talented and motivated individual to join our team as a Cybersecurity Consultant.     Conduct comprehensive audits of our network infrastructure, including but not limited to:?       Firewall configurations?   Intrusion detection/prevention systems?   Network segmentation and access controls?   VPN configurations?   Network traffic analysis?   Security configuration of the VPN setup to our Client environments?       Assess the utilization of public cloud services (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) by our IT team, including:?       Identity and access management (IAM) configurations?   Data encryption practices?   Compliance with industry-specific regulations (if applicable)?   Incident response and data breach protocols?       Collaborate with IT teams to review and enhance existing security policies, procedures, and guidelines related to network and cloud security.?   Provide expert guidance and recommendations for remediation of identified vulnerabilities and security gaps.?   Leverage knowledge of emerging threats, vulnerabilities, and best practices in network and cloud security, and incorporate relevant insights into audit processes and recommendations.?       Prepare and present detailed audit reports to senior management, highlighting findings, recommendations, and action plans for improving security capability.?   Serve as a subject matter expert on cybersecurity matters, providing guidance and support to IT teams and other relevant stakeholders.?   Audit security practices in terms of project lifecycle stages in terms of key/token management, accessing client-data.?   Audit current responsibilities and process gaps with existing roles ??CISO, System Administration and other day-to-day IT functions?   Audit the data privacy of internal applications ??MIS(Nucleus), Finance Payroll systems (SARAL), and other key systems.?      If you are passionate about cybersecurity and are looking for a challenging and rewarding career opportunity with a leading global organization, we encourage you to apply for the position of Cybersecurity Consultant at Torry Harris Integration Solutions. Join us in making a difference in the world of cybersecurity.    Roles and Responsibilities   The role of a cybersecurity consultant is crucial in today's digital age, as businesses and organizations strive to protect their data and systems from cyber threats. A cybersecurity consultant is responsible for helping clients assess their current security measures, identify potential vulnerabilities, and develop strategies to mitigate risks. This involves a wide range of duties and requires an in-depth understanding of cybersecurity principles, technologies, and best practices. In this blog, we will explore the key roles and responsibilities of a cybersecurity consultant.   ?   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (Master's degree preferred).   Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), or other relevant certifications preferred.   Proven experience (10 years) in conducting cybersecurity audits, with a focus on network infrastructure and cloud services.   Deep understanding of network security principles, protocols, and technologies.   Extensive knowledge of public cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and associated security best practices.   Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to identify vulnerabilities and assess risk effectively.   Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.   Proven track record of working effectively in a collaborative team environment.
column11: it security, public cloud, cloud services, cyber security, analytical, network security, consulting, information security, microsoft azure, cloud platforms, vulnerability assessment, conducting, malware analysis, gcp, data privacy, ethical hacking, protocols, aws, communication skills

Must have skills : Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE BTECH MTECH  Summary :The Content Engineer/Team Lead will be responsible for Google Chronicle" SIEM/ SOAR content development such as correlation rules, dashboards, reports, custom parsers, SOAR Playbooks. This involves researching and understanding security threats and vulnerabilities and translating that knowledge into actionable content that can be used to detect and respond to security incidents. Roles & Responsibilities: Expert in developing complex correlation rules, playbooks, policies, and custom parsers.  Monitor the effectiveness of content and tune content to minimize false positives and maximize true positives. Conduct ongoing research and participate in industry forums and conferences to stay up to date with the latest security trends to ensure content effectiveness in detecting and preventing new threats. Automate content development and maintenance processes including the use of scripting and other automation tools to streamline content creation and testing. Design and implement security automation and orchestration workflows for areas such as incident triage, threat intelligence and vulnerability management using SOAR platforms, scripting, and API integration. Integrate security tools into the SOAR platform. Manage and analyze data related to security incidents, threats, and vulnerabilities to identify trends and patterns and use this to develop more effective workflows and improve overall security operations. Maintain detailed logs and reports of security automation and orchestration activities, including metrics related to workflow efficiency, incident response times and threat detection rates to provide internal and external stakeholders with updates on SOAR effectiveness. Professional & Technical Skills: At least 5+ years of experience in Information Security, Risk Management, Infrastructure Security. 4+ years of hands-on experience on developing use cases with deep understanding on SIEM configurations, SOAR Playbooks, log parsing etc. Expert in developing complex correlation rules, playbooks, policies, and custom parsers.  Creation of customized dashboards, alerts, and reports. Good understanding of Regular Expression (REGEX), Yara L. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Additional Information: Certifications such as ECSA, ITIL, GIAC-GCIA. Advanced Certification on any SIEM or SOAR products. Knowledge about scripting languages, Python, PowerShell.Education: Bachelor's and above degree in Computer Science, Information & Technology, MIS, Engineering. Qualification BE BTECH MTECH

column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Must have skills : Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operations Good to have skills : NA Minimum  15  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Minimum 15 years of full time education Summary :As a Security Architect, you will be responsible for defining the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Your typical day will involve documenting the implementation of the cloud security controls and transitioning to cloud security-managed operations. Responsibilities: Architect end-to-end IAM solutions based on business needs, considering scalability, security, and usability. Develop IAM architectures, including identity provisioning, access management, single sign-on, and directory services. Lead the implementation of IAM frameworks, defining standards, policies, and procedures. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and align IAM solutions with organizational goals. Evaluate and select appropriate IAM technologies and tools, considering industry best practices. Provide technical leadership and guidance to IAM implementation teams, ensuring successful project delivery. Conduct assessments and audits of existing IAM systems, identifying areas for improvement and optimization. Stay updated on emerging IAM trends, technologies, and security threats, incorporating them into the architecture where applicable.Requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field. 15+ years of experience in IAM architecture design and implementation. Deep expertise in IAM technologies such as (but not limited to) Identity Governance, Privileged Access Management, LDAP, SSO, etc. Strong understanding of identity protocols (e.g., OAuth, SAML, OpenID Connect) and security frameworks. Experience with cloud-based IAM solutions and integration with enterprise systems. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail. Effective communication skills and the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISA are advantageous. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 15 years of experience in Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operations. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful security solutions. This position is based at our Noida office. Qualification Minimum 15 years of full time education

Strong knowledge of security policies, procedures, and standards, with the ability to develop and maintain them. column2: Project Role : Security Architect Project Role Description : Define the cloud security framework and architecture, ensuring it meets the business requirements and performance goals. Document the implementation of the cloud security controls and transition to cloud security-managed operations.  Must have skills : Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE BTECH MTECH  Summary :The Content Engineer/Team Lead will be responsible for Google Chronicle" SIEM/ SOAR content development such as correlation rules, dashboards, reports, custom parsers, SOAR Playbooks. This involves researching and understanding security threats and vulnerabilities and translating that knowledge into actionable content that can be used to detect and respond to security incidents. Roles & Responsibilities: Expert in developing complex correlation rules, playbooks, policies, and custom parsers.  Monitor the effectiveness of content and tune content to minimize false positives and maximize true positives. Conduct ongoing research and participate in industry forums and conferences to stay up to date with the latest security trends to ensure content effectiveness in detecting and preventing new threats. Automate content development and maintenance processes including the use of scripting and other automation tools to streamline content creation and testing. Design and implement security automation and orchestration workflows for areas such as incident triage, threat intelligence and vulnerability management using SOAR platforms, scripting, and API integration. Integrate security tools into the SOAR platform. Manage and analyze data related to security incidents, threats, and vulnerabilities to identify trends and patterns and use this to develop more effective workflows and improve overall security operations. Maintain detailed logs and reports of security automation and orchestration activities, including metrics related to workflow efficiency, incident response times and threat detection rates to provide internal and external stakeholders with updates on SOAR effectiveness. Professional & Technical Skills: At least 5+ years of experience in Information Security, Risk Management, Infrastructure Security. 4+ years of hands-on experience on developing use cases with deep understanding on SIEM configurations, SOAR Playbooks, log parsing etc. Expert in developing complex correlation rules, playbooks, policies, and custom parsers.  Creation of customized dashboards, alerts, and reports. Good understanding of Regular Expression (REGEX), Yara L. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Additional Information: Certifications such as ECSA, ITIL, GIAC-GCIA. Advanced Certification on any SIEM or SOAR products. Knowledge about scripting languages, Python, PowerShell.Education: Bachelor's and above degree in Computer Science, Information & Technology, MIS, Engineering. Qualification BE BTECH MTECH
